name: Inn at Laurel Point

reviews.text: We had a lovely time in an airy, clean room with a beautiful view and fun balcony -perfect for enjoying a romantic bottle of champagne - overlooking the harbor. The staff was friendly and helpful. The biggest surprise was finding a delicious cioppino in the bar! That particular dish was as well prepared as the lunch we had at Pescatore's. Bring good walking shoes, so much to see within a short walk.
reviews.title: Loved the view!
very nice
reviews.text: stayed at the laurel point inn on April 22 and 23. Totally enjoyed it. Very good staff and clean rooms.

reviews.title: What a Cruel Joke
reviews.text: Coming off of an incredible week of honeymooning on Vancouver Island we decided to spend our last night at the Laurel Point Inn. What a horrible mistake this was!

We were not able to check in until 4 PM and had to drag our luggage around with us all over Victoria. Finally, when we were able to check in we received an "upgrade" to the one bedroom suite. Ahhhh.....how wonderful, nothing like stained furniture, torn and stained carpets, dirty bathrooms, and holes in the wall to set the mood.
reviews.title: A beautiful harborside hotel

reviews.text: We booked our stay at Laurel Point through Clipper Vacations and were promised a Harbor View room. We checked in on the late side (after 6 pm) and were assigned a pleasant room on the ground floor overlooking a zen garden with an obstructed view of the outer harbor. Although it was acceptable, there was a walking path outside and we were unable to leave the sliding glass door open to the wonderful Vicoria night air.
reviews.title: Lovely stay- caring staff

reviews.text: We informed Tannis, a lovely young lady on the reception staff, and we were upgraded the following night to a jr. suite on the third floor with a stunning view of the inner harbor. Additionally, she sent up two delicious chocolate bars and a note of congratulations since it was our anniversary.
reviews.title: Won't stay here again
Understated elegance
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again. The grounds are lovely, it is convenient to walk to the inner harbor, but just far enough away to be peaceful and relaxing. Also, if taking the Clipper, you can walk easily to the dock.

My stay at the Laurel Point Inn was terrible. The motel is equivalent to a Motel 6 with a fancy lobby and exorbitant prices. I stayed in the fancy new South wing of the motel in a "deluxe" room. The most significant problem is the noise. I have traveled a lot and have never stayed in a motel as noisy as the Laurel Point. The plumbing makes continuous, loud noises all night long, and I mean loud. The walls are very thin and you can easily hear anything going on in adjacent rooms or in the hallway. To top it off the Laurel point allows the bar to stay open until about 11:00 at night playing terrible but very loud music. The noise alone would be enough to rule this motel out for all but deaf occupants.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Quoted price not honored
reviews.text: The next issue I had was that the motel is not very nice for the price. The rooms are tiny and not all that clean. Also, I paid for a nicer view room and ended up in a tiny room on the ground floor bordering a busy walking path. The one tiny window opened onto a mostly obscured view of the waterfront, but a totally un-obscured view of hundreds of people walking by right in front of the room. The room was misrepresented by the motel to say the least and should have been offered at a discounted price and accurately represented by Laurel Point.

reviews.title: Overlooking the harbour
reviews.text: Our family of 4 adults stayed at the Laurel Point Inn from 30 June to 3 July in our trip across Western Canada, having booked 2 rooms through Expedia so as to be in Victoria on Canada Day (1 July).

reviews.title: First Class
reviews.text: The hotel was reasonably easy to find in Victoria but you do need a map! It is on the opposite side of the beautiful harbour from downtown Victoria, past the queues for the ferry to the USA.

reviews.title: A View To Die For
reviews.text: The hotel is very attractive and we had chosen it for its location, within 5 minutes walk of the town, and for its views across the harbour having asked for rooms facing the inner harbour. Unfortunately our rooms on the 2nd floor turned out to look straight out onto trees. The reception staff could not have been more helpful; they were absolutely brilliant and rearranged for us to get rooms on the 4th floor so that we could not only see the beautiful inner harbour but also watch the Canada Day fireworks.

reviews.title: New Wing Is Amazing! - Old Wing Isn't!
reviews.text: We did not eat in the restaurant, tending to eat downtown but the restaurant looked pleasant if a little pricey. Facilities in the rooms were good - the usual air conditioning, big TV, coffee maker, very comfy beds, lots of room and a balcony.
Parking is underground and you have to pay. Our hire car was a big SUV too high to get into the entrance so we parked in the access road to the hotel which is a cul de sac.
reviews.title: Deeeee-Lighted
A Fabulous Stay
reviews.text: It's been almost a year since my husband and I took a quick weekend trip to Victoria, but I still can't help raving about this hotel. We disembarked from the Clipper a little earlier than check-in, but the front desk was happy to hold our luggage while we strolled Victoria, had a little lunch, and then came back to check into our room.

reviews.title: Old, dated, and overrated!
reviews.text: When our room wasn't ready about two hours later (still before check-in time), the front desk clerk handed us two drink vouchers and directed us to the hotel lounge to wait. Very much appreciated, especially since I was five months pregnant at the time! (No, I didn't have alcohol, but it was nice to get a soda and sit down.)

Our room was fabulous, to say the very least. It was quiet, clean, and much larger than I'd expected. I don't think that the room itself was larger than most hotel rooms, but the layout gave it much more of a roomier feel. My husband and I adored our spacious balcony and the gorgeous waterview right outside our room. Ooh, and I can't say more good things about the huge bathroom - I wanted to find a way to take it home with me!
reviews.title: Luxury abounds
Great Experience
reviews.text: All in all, I loved my stay at the Laurel Point...it was a wonderful place to come back to after a long day of walking around Victoria. I'd go back there again in a heartbeat!

aka: Inn At Laurel Point Hotel Victoria
